intro: Aulomyrcia insularis var. opaca, commonly known as the opaque aulomyrcia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific island habitats. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its unique leaf structure and pale, waxy flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often on rocky or forested terrain. Its varietal distinction, opaca, refers to the opaque or dull appearance of its foliage. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
